instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SM_RESET_L: What is SM_RESET_L? This is a typo of SMC_RESET_L When you see SM_RESET_L, assume they meant to type SMC_RESET_L.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SM_RESET_L</SIGNAL> pulsing on/off
threads.message: Hi, I have an 3115 that had no green light, I replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5490</TRANSISTOR> as it was black and the board came back to life got a green light again and 12.6v on PPBUS.. After I ultrasonic-ed it the green light was going on/off all the time like 3 seconds off, 1 second on. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is pulsing between 0 and 3.43v. PPBUS is moving between 3.3v and 9v and then reset. If I wait few minutes the fan starts to spin (high) but no chime yet.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SM_RESET_L</SIGNAL> pulsing on/off
